results.title: A Century of responsible government
results.creator_credit: John Dixon, Cine Service and Government of Victoria
results.brief_description: On 21st November, 1956, Victoria celebrated the centenary of responsible government in that State. To mark the occasion, the fortieth session of Parliament was formally opened by Sir Dallas Brookes, Governor of Victoria. At the ceremony Sir Dallas read a congratulatory message from the Queen and part of the speech made by Lieutenant McArthur when he opened the first Victorian Parliament in 1856. Also available on DVD [319320].

results.title: Centre court champions
results.creator_credit: Howard Rubie, British Petroleum and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Demonstrations of good play in tennis on a grass court and a hard court with comments by Harry Hopman. Emphasizes the need for good balance, skill in service, a great variety of strokes, and agile footwork; with some sequences in slow motion. Top Australian players are shown in action, including Tony Roche, John Newcombe, Owen Davidson and Lesley Turner. Concludes with the 1965 Australian Singles Finals, in black and white, with Roy Emerson and Fred Stolle.

results.title: The Centre
results.brief_description: A promotional film of Alice Springs and environs, covering its services, facilities and tourist features. Includes footage on Uluru (Ayers Rock). Narrated by John Laws.
results.description: A promotional film of Alice Springs and environs, covering its services, facilities and tourist features. Includes footage on Uluru (Ayers Rock). Narrated by John Laws.

results.title: Centralia
results.brief_description: Depicts scenic places around Alice Springs, Stanley’s Chasm, Hermannsburg, Ormiston Gorge, Glen Helen Gorge, Ayres Rock and The Olgas, and discusses the geology, history, living conditions and aboriginal mythology of the areas shown. Narrated by Ron Haddrick.

results.title: Central similarities (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Allen Downs, Jay Hines and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Dilatations (central similarities) are introduced to solve the problem of inscribing an ellipse to touch the sides of a given triangle at their midpoints. Coordinate geometry is also introduced to solve a subsidiary problem stressing the importance of the geometric interpretation of algebraic equations. Narrated by Delbert Ball.

results.title: Central perspectives (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Art Landy and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Reviews the definition of range and pencil. Introduces the basic projective transformation, namely the central perspectivity. When the narrator poses the question of the number of points required to uniquely determine a projectivity (product of perspectivity) the viewer is led to the fundamental theorem of projective geometry.

results.title: Central America (Caribbean region II)
results.brief_description: The climate, geography, economic interdependence on the rest of the world, the industries, and the peoples of Central America, are studied briefly in this film. The region’s position and importance in the Carribbean area, and its political history from the time of Columbus to the present, are sketched with the aid of animated diagrams.

results.title: The Centenary test
results.brief_description: This film consists of highlights from the 1977 Centenary Test Match played at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, March 12th-17th, between Australia and England. It contains interviews by Richie Benaud with former and current players of both teams and commentators include Norman May, Frank Tyson, Jim Laker, Keith Miller and Paul Sheahan.

results.title: Centaur
results.creator_credit: Susan Gibbard, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The camera-work, music and colours of this film combine to express the joy of horses and horsemanship. Filmed with members of the Canadian Equestrian Team and designed to capture the essence of the sport where horse and rider seem to move as one. (Awards: Reims, Yorkton, Chantilly)

results.title: Celluloid college: basic motion picture technique
results.creator_credit: Emil E. Brodbeck, Roy Creveling and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: An instructional film for amateur movie makers; includes demonstrations and explanations of panning, using the tripod; shot break down; screen direction; matching; newsreel shooting; build-up; composition; indoor lighting. Concludes by presenting an amusing short play in which all the techniques emphasized in the film are incorporated.
